title: Sanguette (French Blood Pancake)
steps: Peel 1 garlic clove. Rub the bread slice with it until the garlic is used up. Cut bread into small cubes and place in a shallow dish.
Peel and finely chop the onion, shallot, and remaining garlic clove. Chop the parsley.
Add the chopped vegetables and parsley to the bread cubes. Mix well.
Pour fresh chicken blood evenly over the bread mixture. Let soak and coagulate for a few minutes.
Heat duck fat in a heavy-bottomed skillet over medium-high heat.
Once fat is melted and very hot, slide the blood mixture into the pan.
Cook like a pancake for 6-7 minutes per side, seasoning each side generously with salt and pepper.
When cooked through, slide the sanguette onto a warm serving plate.
Deglaze the pan with red wine vinegar, scraping well with a spatula.
Pour the deglazed juices over the sanguette and serve immediately.
notes: Volume conversions: Fresh blood ≈ 240g (1 cup), 1 slice bread ≈ 50g, 2 garlic cloves ≈ 10g, 1 onion ≈ 150g, 1 shallot ≈ 30g, 4 parsley sprigs ≈ 8g, 1 tbsp duck fat ≈ 14g, vinegar ≈ 15g (1 tbsp)
Traditional French country dish from poultry-raising regions
Fresh chicken blood must be from freshly slaughtered chicken
Blood will coagulate when mixed with bread
Served as a savory pancake or galette
